Of course, I would be happy to help you negotiate with the landlord. Based on the current market rates in New York, an offer of €800 per month for a 25 square meter apartment is quite reasonable. While I can't guarantee that the landlord will accept this offer, I can certainly try to help you make a strong case for why this price is fair.

Here are a few points you could consider when making your argument:

* The size and location of the apartment may impact its value. While 25 square meters may seem small, it may still be a desirable size and location for some tenants. Be sure to emphasize any unique features or advantages of the apartment that may make it more valuable.
* The condition and amenities of the apartment may also be factors in determining its rental value. If the apartment is in good condition and has desirable amenities such as a balcony or parking space, this could justify a higher rental price.
* Finally, you may want to consider offering a longer lease term in exchange for a lower rental price. Many landlords are willing to offer lower rent to tenants who commit to a longer lease, as this can provide more stability for both parties.

Keep in mind that negotiation is a two-way street, and the landlord may have counteroffers or concerns that you will need to address. However, by presenting a strong case for why €800 per month is a fair rental price based on current market rates and the specific features of the apartment, you may be able to come to an agreement that works for both parties.

I hope this helps, and best of luck with your negotiations!
